original: @126b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @126b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: sha dam ga s'a dha nam n'a ma /
analyzed: sha dam ga s'a dha nam n'a ma /
translated: Sadangayoga-sādhana-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: yan lag drug pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: yan lag drug pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Achievement called the Six Branches

original: kye rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: kye rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Hevajra.

original: dkyil 'khor sgyu ma la bzhugs chu zla dang mtshungs lha mo brgyad kyi bdag /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor sgyu ma la bzhugs chu zla dang mtshungs lha mo brgyad kyi bdag /
translated: Abiding in the mandala of illusion, equal to the moon in water, the lord of the eight goddesses,

original: kye'i rdo rje rnam thar bsdu dngos de bzhin nyid kyi zhal dang zhabs phyag sprul //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje rnam thar bsdu dngos de bzhin nyid kyi zhal dang zhabs phyag sprul //
translated: Hevajra, the means of gathering liberation, with the face and feet of suchness emanated,

original: bdud kyi snying ga nyams dga' ba yi gnas su sems can don mdzad dgyes //
analyzed: bdud kyi snying ga nyams dga' ba yi gnas su sems can don mdzad dgyes //
translated: Delighting in the place of the delightful heart of Māra, acting for the benefit of sentient beings,🔽The dancer, like the sky, acting proudly, protecting migrating beings,

original: gar mkhan nam mkha' lta bus dregs par mdzad cing 'gro ba bsrung ba dang // dang po sangs rgyas kyi sprul sku 'dra ba //
analyzed: gar mkhan nam mkha' lta bus dregs par mdzad cing 'gro ba bsrung ba dang // dang po sangs rgyas kyi sprul sku 'dra ba //
translated: Like the emanation body of the primordial Buddha,

original: skye ba'i chu bo sgrol ba'i theg gcig pa //
analyzed: skye ba'i chu bo sgrol ba'i theg gcig pa //
translated: The one vehicle that liberates the river of birth,

original: bla ma la gus phyag 'tshal rtog pa yin //
analyzed: bla ma la gus phyag 'tshal rtog pa yin //
translated: The homage of devotion to the guru is the thought.

original: kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud chen rgya mtsho lta bu las //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud chen rgya mtsho lta bu las //
translated: From the great ocean of the Hevajra Tantra,

original: dom bi'i zhal snga nas kyi rim rnyed pas //
analyzed: dom bi'i zhal snga nas kyi rim rnyed pas //
translated: The stages found by Ācārya Ḍombipa,

original: kye rdo rje'i shr'i'i sgrub thabs ni //🔽mi shes sgrib g-yogs mun 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: kye rdo rje'i shr'i'i sgrub thabs ni // mi shes sgrib g-yogs mun 'dra ba'i //
translated: The Śāradā Śrī Heruka Sādhana🔽This scalpel is begun

original: thur ma 'di ni brtsam par bya //
analyzed: thur ma 'di ni brtsam par bya //
translated: to cut the darkness of the obscurations of ignorance.

original: dngos grub kyi ni sems 'di yis //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi ni sems 'di yis //
translated: With this mind of spiritual powers,🔽at night in one's own home,

original: mtshan mo'i dus su rang khyim dang // dur khrod chu 'gram de dag tu //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i dus su rang khyim dang // dur khrod chu 'gram de dag tu //
translated: in a charnel ground, or on a riverbank,

original: 'jigs pa med par bsam gtan bya //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par bsam gtan bya //
translated: one should meditate without fear.

original: snying gar chu skyes nyi ma de'o //
analyzed: snying gar chu skyes nyi ma de'o //
translated: In the heart, on the lotus and sun,

original: gzugs brnyan h'u% las khyad par bsgom //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan h'u% las khyad par bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on the special form of Hūṃ.

original: bla ma rdo rje mchod nas ni //
analyzed: bla ma rdo rje mchod nas ni //
translated: Having worshipped the guru and vajra,

original: bdun po yongs su dag par ni //
analyzed: bdun po yongs su dag par ni //
translated: one should delight in the seven complete purities.

original: goo r'i la sogs lha mo brgyad //
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs lha mo brgyad //
translated: The eight goddesses beginning with Gaurī

original: mchod pa yongs su spro bar bya //
analyzed: mchod pa yongs su spro bar bya //
translated: should be delighted with offerings.🔽Confessing misdeeds,🔽vowing not to do them again,🔽rejoicing in merit,🔽and dedicating it all,

original: sdig pa byas pa bshags pa dang // byed pa yang ni sdom pa dang // bsod nams rjes su yi rang dang // de dag yongs su bsngo bar bgyi //
analyzed: sdig pa byas pa bshags pa dang // byed pa yang ni sdom pa dang // bsod nams rjes su yi rang dang // de dag yongs su bsngo bar bgyi //
translated: going for refuge to the Three Jewels,🔽generating the supreme mind of enlightenment,

original: dkon mchog skyabs su 'gro ba dang // byang chub mchog sems bskyed pa dang // lam la gnas shing bdag kyang ni //
analyzed: dkon mchog skyabs su 'gro ba dang // byang chub mchog sems bskyed pa dang // lam la gnas shing bdag kyang ni //
translated: and abiding on the path,

original: gzhan gyi don du dbul ba dang // gnang ba nod dang tshangs pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du dbul ba dang // gnang ba nod dang tshangs pa yi //
translated: For the sake of others, one should meditate on the four contemplations:🔽poverty, taking leave,

original: gnas ni bzhi po'i bsam gtan bya //
analyzed: gnas ni bzhi po'i bsam gtan bya //
translated: and the abode of Brahma.

original: dang po byams pa bsgom bya zhing //
analyzed: dang po byams pa bsgom bya zhing //
translated: First, one should cultivate loving kindness;

original: gnyis pa snying rje'i bye brag bsgom //
analyzed: gnyis pa snying rje'i bye brag bsgom //
translated: second, one should cultivate compassion;

original: gsum pa dga' ba bsgom pa ste //
analyzed: gsum pa dga' ba bsgom pa ste //
translated: third, one should cultivate joy;

original: thams cad tha ma @127a * //
analyzed: thams cad tha ma @127a * //
translated: and all of them in the end

original: btang snyoms so //🔽yang ni stong pa'i byang chub ni //
analyzed: btang snyoms so // yang ni stong pa'i byang chub ni //
translated: are equanimity.🔽Moreover, one should cultivate and recite

original: bsgom zhing 'di ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: bsgom zhing 'di ni brjod par bya //
translated: the enlightenment of emptiness.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ

original: stong pad ram skyes h'u% dngos la //
analyzed: stong pad ram skyes h'u% dngos la //
translated: In the empty lotus-born bhaga,

original: sna tshogs rdo rje'i bsam gtan bya //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje'i bsam gtan bya //
translated: one should contemplate the vajra cross.🔽From the bhaga, one should radiate

original: 'gro ba'i bdud rnams sel byed pa'i //🔽h'u% las gsal bar spro bar bya //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bdud rnams sel byed pa'i // h'u% las gsal bar spro bar bya //
translated: the illuminator that dispels the māras of beings.

original: aom raksha raksha h'u% h'u% h'u% phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom raksha raksha h'u% h'u% h'u% phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ rakṣa rakṣa hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā

original: yi ge 'di brjod do //
analyzed: yi ge 'di brjod do //
translated: One should recite this mantra.🔽From this, one should visualize

original: 'di las rdo rje bskor ba'i gur //🔽bla re yang ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 'di las rdo rje bskor ba'i gur // bla re yang ni bsgom par bya //
translated: the vajra-encircled canopy and tent.

original: rdo rje'i sa la nam mkha'i dbyings //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sa la nam mkha'i dbyings //
translated: The vajra ground, the space element,

original: yam ram bam lam byung ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: yam ram bam lam byung ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The maṇḍala arises from yam, ram, vam, and lam.

original: bhr'um las 'khor lo'i steng du bdag / bar ma'i skyes pa'i bsam gtan bya //
analyzed: bhr'um las 'khor lo'i steng du bdag / bar ma'i skyes pa'i bsam gtan bya //
translated: From bhrūṃ, above the wheel, I visualize the intermediate being’s meditative concentration.

original: 'di ni 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhi //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhi //
translated: This is the fourfold maṇḍala of the elements.

original: 'khor lo 'di ni lnga pa'o //🔽gcig 'gyur de las sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'di ni lnga pa'o // gcig 'gyur de las sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: This is the fifth wheel.

original: gzhal yas khang du gyur pa ste //🔽ngos bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang du gyur pa ste // ngos bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
translated: It becomes one, the celestial mansion of the buddhas.🔽It has four sides and four gates,

original: rta babs bzhis ni rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: rta babs bzhis ni rnam par brgyan //
translated: adorned with four porticos.

original: dra ba dra phyed yang dag ldan //
analyzed: dra ba dra phyed yang dag ldan //
translated: It is endowed with nets and half-nets,

original: ka ba brgyad kyis shin tu spras //
analyzed: ka ba brgyad kyis shin tu spras //
translated: and is well-adorned with eight pillars.

original: lha mo brgyad kyi 'od rnams ni //
analyzed: lha mo brgyad kyi 'od rnams ni //
translated: The light of the eight goddesses

original: gsal ba yis ni snam bu yin //
analyzed: gsal ba yis ni snam bu yin //
translated: is the radiant cloth.

original: 'di ni chu skyes 'dab ma ni //
analyzed: 'di ni chu skyes 'dab ma ni //
translated: This is the eight-petaled lotus,

original: brgyad pa bri zhing phreng ba gcig / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i //
analyzed: brgyad pa bri zhing phreng ba gcig / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i //
translated: drawn with a single string,

original: bdud bzhi yis ni rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: bdud bzhi yis ni rnam par brgyan //
translated: adorned with the four māras,🔽situated in the center of the sun maṇḍala.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa l'a n'i ya badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ho //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa l'a n'i ya badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ho //
translated: oṃ sarvatathāgatā lāni vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ

original: sangs rgyas pho brang bye brag rdzogs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pho brang bye brag rdzogs //
translated: The palace of the Buddha is complete.

original: rnam pa lnga po bsgom pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po bsgom pa ni //
translated: The meditation on the five aspects

original: zla ba me long ye shes te //
analyzed: zla ba me long ye shes te //
translated: is the moon, the mirror-like pristine awareness;

original: rta bdun pa ni mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: rta bdun pa ni mnyam pa nyid //
translated: the seven horses are the sameness.

original: lha yi sa bon phyag mtshan ni //
analyzed: lha yi sa bon phyag mtshan ni //
translated: The seed syllables of the deities and the hand implements

original: so sor rtog pa yin zhes zer //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa yin zhes zer //
translated: are said to be the discerning pristine awareness.

original: thams cad gcig 'gyur bya nan tan //
analyzed: thams cad gcig 'gyur bya nan tan //
translated: All of them become one, the cultivation,

original: gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa de chos dbyings //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa de chos dbyings //
translated: the reflection, the perfect, the sphere of reality.

original: a'a li bsgom pa zla ba ste //
analyzed: a'a li bsgom pa zla ba ste //
translated: The meditation on the vowels is the moon;

original: k'a li rta bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: k'a li rta bdun pa yin no //
translated: the meditation on the consonants is the seven horses.

original: gnyis kyi bar na aom dang h'um //
analyzed: gnyis kyi bar na aom dang h'um //
translated: Between the two is oṃ and hūṃ,

original: de gnyis rdo rje gri gug gyur //
analyzed: de gnyis rdo rje gri gug gyur //
translated: which become the vajra and flaying skin.

original: zla nyi sa bon phyag mtshan ni //
analyzed: zla nyi sa bon phyag mtshan ni //
translated: The seed syllables of the moon and sun and the hand implements

original: 'di dag thams cad gcig gyur pa //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad gcig gyur pa //
translated: are all of them becoming one.

original: chu dang 'o ma tha dad med //
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma tha dad med //
translated: Like water and milk, they are inseparable.

original: de 'dra'i rdo rje bsam gtan ni //
analyzed: de 'dra'i rdo rje bsam gtan ni //
translated: Such a vajra contemplation

original: zhal brgyad phyag ni bcu drug pa //
analyzed: zhal brgyad phyag ni bcu drug pa //
translated: has eight faces and sixteen arms,

original: 'jigs byed zhabs ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs byed zhabs ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: is Bhairava with four legs,

original: dpa' bo thod pa'i phreng ba can //
analyzed: dpa' bo thod pa'i phreng ba can //
translated: is the hero with a garland of skulls,

original: bdag med ma yis phrag nas 'khyud //
analyzed: bdag med ma yis phrag nas 'khyud //
translated: is embraced by the shoulder of Nairātmya,

original: phyag rgya lnga ni 'dzin pa'i lha //
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga ni 'dzin pa'i lha //
translated: is the deity who holds the five symbolic ornaments.

original: zla ba'i nor bu kha dog 'od //
analyzed: zla ba'i nor bu kha dog 'od //
translated: The moon is a jewel of color and light.

original: rtsa ba'i lus mdog g-yon gyi ni //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i lus mdog g-yon gyi ni //
translated: The color of the basic body is on the left.

original: zhal ni dmar dang dkar dang gzhan //
analyzed: zhal ni dmar dang dkar dang gzhan //
translated: The faces are red, white, and the other.

original: glang po rta bong glang rnga mo //
analyzed: glang po rta bong glang rnga mo //
translated: The elephant, horse, donkey, ox,

original: mi dang seng ge de byi la //
analyzed: mi dang seng ge de byi la //
translated: human, lion, and cat

original: g-yas @127b pa'i thod pa brgyad pa ni //
analyzed: g-yas @127b pa'i thod pa brgyad pa ni //
translated: are on the right, in the eight skull cups.

original: dang po glang po rim shes bya //
analyzed: dang po glang po rim shes bya //
translated: The first is known as the elephant.

original: gzhi dang chu gnas rlung dang ni //🔽me lha de nas snang byed dang / phyi mthar byed dang nor sbyin ni //
analyzed: gzhi dang chu gnas rlung dang ni // me lha de nas snang byed dang / phyi mthar byed dang nor sbyin ni //
translated: The earth, water, air, and fire gods,🔽then the illuminator,

original: g-yon pa'i thod pa brgyad na'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i thod pa brgyad na'o //
translated: the final creator, and Kubera are in the eight skull cups on the left.

original: lha mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma //
analyzed: lha mo zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma //
translated: The goddess has one face and two arms.

original: gnag cing gyen du bsgreng ba ser //
analyzed: gnag cing gyen du bsgreng ba ser //
translated: She is black and stands with her right leg extended and left drawn in.

original: gri gug thod pa kha tv'am ga /'dzin cing stag lpags sham thabs can //
analyzed: gri gug thod pa kha tv'am ga /'dzin cing stag lpags sham thabs can //
translated: She holds a flaying knife, skull cup, and khaṭvāṅga, and wears an apron of tiger skin.

original: aom padma su kh'a dha ra ma h'a r'a ga su khanda da tsa tur /
analyzed: aom padma su kh'a dha ra ma h'a r'a ga su khanda da tsa tur /
translated: Oṃ padmasukhadhara mahārāgasukhacaturānandabhaga-

original: a'a nanda bha ga bi shva h'u% h'u% h'u%/🔽karyam ku ru shva me /
analyzed: a'a nanda bha ga bi shva h'u% h'u% h'u%/ karyam ku ru shva me /
translated: viṣva hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ.🔽Carry out the activity for me.

original: aom badzra ma h'a dve sha tsa tur /
analyzed: aom badzra ma h'a dve sha tsa tur /
translated: Oṃ vajra mahādveṣa caturānanda bhagavīśva hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ.

original: a'a nanda d'a ya ka kha ga mu khee ka ra so n'a tha h'u% h'u% h'u%/
analyzed: a'a nanda d'a ya ka kha ga mu khee ka ra so n'a tha h'u% h'u% h'u%/
translated: Ānanda-dāyaka khaga-mukha kara-sonātha hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ.

original: karyam ku ru shva me /
analyzed: karyam ku ru shva me /
translated: Karyaṃ kuru śva me.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham //
translated: Oṃ sarva-tathāgata-anurāgaṇa vajra-svabhāva ātmako 'ham.

original: dang por skyes bu bsam de nas //
analyzed: dang por skyes bu bsam de nas //
translated: First, one should think of the person,

original: mkha' 'gro ma de'i 'khor lo spro //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma de'i 'khor lo spro //
translated: and then emanate the circle of the dakinis.

original: rdo rje rjes su chags byed pas //
analyzed: rdo rje rjes su chags byed pas //
translated: By the vajra-passion

original: rgyal ba'i khu ba rjes su 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i khu ba rjes su 'gyur //
translated: one becomes the semen of the Victor.

original: sa bon brgyad du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon brgyad du gyur pa'o //
translated: It becomes the eight seed syllables.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thig le de //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thig le de //
translated: That drop of the Tathāgata

original: gam tsam bam gham bam sam lam dam //
analyzed: gam tsam bam gham bam sam lam dam //
translated: is gaṃ, caṃ, vaṃ, ghaṃ, paṃ, śaṃ, laṃ, and daṃ.

original: lha mo'i sa bon dbyung ba'o //🔽goo r'i dbang gshin chom rkun ma //🔽ro langs ma ni chu bdag gnas //
analyzed: lha mo'i sa bon dbyung ba'o // goo r'i dbang gshin chom rkun ma // ro langs ma ni chu bdag gnas //
translated: The seed syllables of the goddesses are emitted.🔽Gaurī is in the southeast, Caṇḍī in the south,

original: ghasma r'i ni gsus po che //
analyzed: ghasma r'i ni gsus po che //
translated: vetālī is in the southwest, and Ghasmarī is in the west.

original: de bzhin pukka s'i dbang ldan //
analyzed: de bzhin pukka s'i dbang ldan //
translated: Pukkāsī is in the northwest, Śavarī is in the north,

original: ri khrod ma ni byin za'i grva //
analyzed: ri khrod ma ni byin za'i grva //
translated: caurī is in the northeast, and ghasmarī is in the Indra corner.

original: gtum mo bden bral la gnas te //
analyzed: gtum mo bden bral la gnas te //
translated: Caṇḍālī abides in the southwest,

original: g-yung mo 'di ni rlung gnas na //
analyzed: g-yung mo 'di ni rlung gnas na //
translated: and ḍombinī abides in the wind direction.

original: lha mo'i 'khor lo rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo'i 'khor lo rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The circle of goddesses is complete.

original: ho gnyis dbus su gnas pa ni //
analyzed: ho gnyis dbus su gnas pa ni //
translated: The two HO syllables are in the center.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi yi ge ste //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi yi ge ste //
translated: These are the syllables of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di ni bar ma'i sems can ming //
analyzed: 'di ni bar ma'i sems can ming //
translated: This is the name of the intermediate being.

original: lha mo'i padmar bsam gtan bya //
analyzed: lha mo'i padmar bsam gtan bya //
translated: One should visualize the deity in the lotus of the goddess.

original: bar ma mnyam par 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: bar ma mnyam par 'jug pa ni //
translated: The intermediate being enters into union.

original: khu ba'i ngo bos rjes su dran //
analyzed: khu ba'i ngo bos rjes su dran //
translated: One should recollect the essence of the seminal fluid.

original: mtshams kyi lha mos bskul ba ste //
analyzed: mtshams kyi lha mos bskul ba ste //
translated: The goddess of the intermediate direction implores:

original: de nas dbyangs kyis bskul bar bya //
analyzed: de nas dbyangs kyis bskul bar bya //
translated: Then one should be implored by melody:

original: snying rje'i yid kyis bla med bzhengs //
analyzed: snying rje'i yid kyis bla med bzhengs //
translated: “Arise, O unsurpassed one, with a compassionate mind!

original: pukka s'i ni bdag la skyobs //
analyzed: pukka s'i ni bdag la skyobs //
translated: O Pukkasi, protect me!

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin spangs nas ni //
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin spangs nas ni //
translated: Abandon the nature of emptiness

original: bdag la 'dod pa'i bde chen sbyor //
analyzed: bdag la 'dod pa'i bde chen sbyor //
translated: and unite with me in the great bliss of desire!

original: khyed mi bzhugs na bdag 'gum pas //
analyzed: khyed mi bzhugs na bdag 'gum pas //
translated: If you do not remain, I will die.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin nyid spangs la //
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin nyid spangs la //
translated: Abandon the nature of emptiness

original: ri khrod ma 'bras grub par ni //
analyzed: ri khrod ma 'bras grub par ni //
translated: and arise, O Pukkasi, for the sake of accomplishment!

original: kye yi rdo rje khyed bzhengs shig /'jig rten phyir smon 'dod pa'i gtso //
analyzed: kye yi rdo rje khyed bzhengs shig /'jig rten phyir smon 'dod pa'i gtso //
translated: Arise, O Hevajra, chief of the desired objects of the world.

original: ci phyir stong pa'i ngang las bzhugs //
analyzed: ci phyir stong pa'i ngang las bzhugs //
translated: Why do you remain in the state of emptiness?

original: khyod mi bzhugs na phyogs mi khums //
analyzed: khyod mi bzhugs na phyogs mi khums //
translated: If you do not remain, the directions will not be stable.

original: gtum mo bdag ni gsol ba 'debs //
analyzed: gtum mo bdag ni gsol ba 'debs //
translated: I, Caṇḍālī, make this request.

original: g-yung mo bdag ni yid rmongs pas //
analyzed: g-yung mo bdag ni yid rmongs pas //
translated: I, the Yoginī, am confused in mind.

original: snying rje rgyun chad ma mdzad par //
analyzed: snying rje rgyun chad ma mdzad par //
translated: Do not cut off the stream of compassion.

original: bdag gis khyod kyi thugs 'tshal gyis //
analyzed: bdag gis khyod kyi thugs 'tshal gyis //
translated: I have understood your mind.

original: khyod ni mig 'phrul lta bur bzhengs //🔽bskul ba'i glu'o //
analyzed: khyod ni mig 'phrul lta bur bzhengs // bskul ba'i glu'o //
translated: You have arisen like a magical illusion.🔽The Song of Exhortation

original: bskul @128a * //🔽bas sngon gyi byang chub kyi //
analyzed: bskul @128a * // bas sngon gyi byang chub kyi //
translated: The Exhortation🔽Remembers the previous aspiration

original: smon lam rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: For enlightenment.

original: khu ba'i gzugs las bzhengs pa ni //
analyzed: khu ba'i gzugs las bzhengs pa ni //
translated: Arisen from the form of semen,

original: aom dang h'u% gnyis rdo rje che //
analyzed: aom dang h'u% gnyis rdo rje che //
translated: The two, Oṃ and Hūṃ, are the great vajra.

original: zhal brgyad zhabs ni bzhi pa ste //
analyzed: zhal brgyad zhabs ni bzhi pa ste //
translated: With eight faces and four feet,

original: phyag ni bcu drug dag gis brgyan //
analyzed: phyag ni bcu drug dag gis brgyan //
translated: Adorned with sixteen hands,

original: bdud bzhi mnyam par mnan pa ste //
analyzed: bdud bzhi mnyam par mnan pa ste //
translated: Equally trampling the four māras,

original: phyed bcas pa yis gar mkhan ni //
analyzed: phyed bcas pa yis gar mkhan ni //
translated: The dancer with half-

original: mgo bo'i phreng bas do shal byas //
analyzed: mgo bo'i phreng bas do shal byas //
translated: Made a necklace of head garlands,

original: sna tshogs rdo rje spyi bor 'dzin //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje spyi bor 'dzin //
translated: Holding a vajra cross on the crown,

original: rtsa ba'i zhal ni nag po che //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i zhal ni nag po che //
translated: The principal face is very black,

original: g-yas pa ku mu da dang mtshungs //
analyzed: g-yas pa ku mu da dang mtshungs //
translated: The right one is like a kumuda flower,

original: g-yon pa dmar po chen po 'jigs //
analyzed: g-yon pa dmar po chen po 'jigs //
translated: The left one is very red and terrifying,

original: phyi ma'i zhal ni bung ba mtshungs //
analyzed: phyi ma'i zhal ni bung ba mtshungs //
translated: The rear face is like a bee.

original: spyan ni nyi shu rtsa bzhis phyug / bdag med ma la bde ba ster //
analyzed: spyan ni nyi shu rtsa bzhis phyug / bdag med ma la bde ba ster //
translated: She is endowed with twenty-four eyes, and bestows bliss on Nairatmya.

original: glang po rta bong glang rnga mong //
analyzed: glang po rta bong glang rnga mong //
translated: The elephants, horses, oxen, camels,

original: mi dang seng ge de byi la //
analyzed: mi dang seng ge de byi la //
translated: humans, lions, cats,

original: g-yas pa'i thod pa brgyad po ni //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i thod pa brgyad po ni //
translated: and the eight skulls on the right

original: dang po glang po rim shes bya //
analyzed: dang po glang po rim shes bya //
translated: are known in the first sequence.

original: gzhi dang chu gnas rlung dang ni //
analyzed: gzhi dang chu gnas rlung dang ni //
translated: Earth, water, wind,🔽fire, moon, sun, and then the illuminator,

original: me zla de nas snang byed dang // phyi mthar byed dang nor sbyin ni //
analyzed: me zla de nas snang byed dang // phyi mthar byed dang nor sbyin ni //
translated: and at the end, the one who makes the end, and Kubera,

original: g-yon ba'i thod pa brgyad na'o //
analyzed: g-yon ba'i thod pa brgyad na'o //
translated: are in the eight skulls on the left.🔽Gauri is black,

original: goo r'i kha dog nag mo'o //🔽chom rkun ma ni btsod dang mtshungs //
analyzed: goo r'i kha dog nag mo'o // chom rkun ma ni btsod dang mtshungs //
translated: and the color of vermilion.🔽Vetali is the color of burnt gold,

original: ro langs ma ni gser bsregs mdog / ghasma r'i ni margat mtshungs //
analyzed: ro langs ma ni gser bsregs mdog / ghasma r'i ni margat mtshungs //
translated: and Ghasmari is the color of an emerald.

original: pukka s'i ni dbang sngon mo //🔽ri khrod ma ni zla nor 'od //
analyzed: pukka s'i ni dbang sngon mo // ri khrod ma ni zla nor 'od //
translated: Pukkasi is the color of sapphire,🔽and Champas is the color of moonlight.

original: gtum mo nam mkha'i sngo bsangs ma //
analyzed: gtum mo nam mkha'i sngo bsangs ma //
translated: Chandika is the color of the dark blue sky,

original: g-yung mo sna tshogs pa ru 'dod //
analyzed: g-yung mo sna tshogs pa ru 'dod //
translated: and Gauri is considered to be multicolored.

original: goo r'i g-yas na gri gug ste //
analyzed: goo r'i g-yas na gri gug ste //
translated: Gauri's right hand holds a curved knife,

original: g-yon na nya ni de bzhin no ;
analyzed: g-yon na nya ni de bzhin no ;
translated: and the left holds a fish.

original: / chom rkun ma g-yas cang te'u ste //
analyzed: / chom rkun ma g-yas cang te'u ste //
translated: The right hand of Chamundi holds a damaru,🔽and the left holds a skull.

original: g-yon na phag pa de bzhin no //🔽ro langs ma g-yas rus sbal te //
analyzed: g-yon na phag pa de bzhin no // ro langs ma g-yas rus sbal te //
translated: On the left is a pig, just so.🔽On the right of Vetālī is a tortoise,

original: g-yon pa'i lag pa thod pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i lag pa thod pa'o //
translated: and in the left hand is a skull.

original: za phod ma yi g-yas na sbrul //
analyzed: za phod ma yi g-yas na sbrul //
translated: On the right of Ghasmarī is a snake,

original: g-yon pa'i lag pa thod pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i lag pa thod pa'o //
translated: and in the left hand is a skull.

original: pukka s'i g-yas seng ge ste //
analyzed: pukka s'i g-yas seng ge ste //
translated: On the right of Pukkasī is a lion,

original: g-yon pa'i phyag na dgra sta 'dzin //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i phyag na dgra sta 'dzin //
translated: and in the left hand is a battle-ax.🔽On the right of Caṇḍālī is a bhikṣu,

original: ri khrod ma g-yas dge slong ste //🔽g-yon pa na ni gsil byed shes //
analyzed: ri khrod ma g-yas dge slong ste // g-yon pa na ni gsil byed shes //
translated: and in the left hand is a mendicant’s staff.

original: gtum mo g-yas na 'khor lo ste //
analyzed: gtum mo g-yas na 'khor lo ste //
translated: On the right of Ucchuṣmi is a wheel,

original: g-yon na thod pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yon na thod pa de bzhin no //
translated: and in the left hand is a skull, just so.

original: g-yung mo g-yas na rdo rje ste //
analyzed: g-yung mo g-yas na rdo rje ste //
translated: On the right of Caṇḍālī is a vajra,

original: g-yon na sdigs mdzub de bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yon na sdigs mdzub de bzhin no //
translated: and in the left hand is a threatening forefinger, just so.

original: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis gnas //
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis gnas //
translated: She stands in the ardhaparyaṅka dance posture,

original: goo r'i la sogs phyag gnyis shes ;
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs phyag gnyis shes ;
translated: with two arms, known as Gaurī and so forth.

original: / spyan gsum skra ni gyen du yin //
analyzed: / spyan gsum skra ni gyen du yin //
translated: She has three eyes and upward-streaming hair,

original: phyag rgya lnga yis shin tu mdzes //
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga yis shin tu mdzes //
translated: and is very beautiful with the five symbolic ornaments.🔽Brahmā, Indra, Virūḍhaka, Yama, Kubera,

original: tshangs pa dbang po nye dbang drag / gshin rje nor gyi bdag po dang // bden bral dang ni thags bzangs ris //
analyzed: tshangs pa dbang po nye dbang drag / gshin rje nor gyi bdag po dang // bden bral dang ni thags bzangs ris //
translated: Varuṇa, and Vemacitrin

original: goo r'i la sogs pa yi gdan //
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs pa yi gdan //
translated: are the seats of Gaurī and so forth.

original: thams cad rdo rje 'di yis ni //
analyzed: thams cad rdo rje 'di yis ni //
translated: Everything is this vajra.🔽From the complete letters of one’s mantra,

original: rang sngags yi ge @128b rdzogs pa dang // phyag rgya phyag mtshan gyur pa las //
analyzed: rang sngags yi ge @128b rdzogs pa dang // phyag rgya phyag mtshan gyur pa las //
translated: the mudra, and the hand implement,

original: snying gar ye shes bsam gtan bya //
analyzed: snying gar ye shes bsam gtan bya //
translated: imagine the wisdom at the heart.

original: rang snying pad nyir h'u% rdo rje //
analyzed: rang snying pad nyir h'u% rdo rje //
translated: In one’s heart, on a lotus and sun, is hūṃ vajra.

original: h'u% ye shes sems dpa' bzhugs pa'i snying //
analyzed: h'u% ye shes sems dpa' bzhugs pa'i snying //
translated: The hūṃ is the heart of the wisdom being.

original: pad nyir gnas pa'i h'u% rdo rje //
analyzed: pad nyir gnas pa'i h'u% rdo rje //
translated: The hūṃ vajra that abides on the lotus and sun

original: h'u% ye shes rjes su bsam pa'o //🔽dam tshig 'khor lo la mnyam thim //
analyzed: h'u% ye shes rjes su bsam pa'o // dam tshig 'khor lo la mnyam thim //
translated: is the wisdom being.🔽The wisdom being dissolves into the pledge being.

original: ye shes 'khor lo chen po 'bar //
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo chen po 'bar //
translated: The great blazing wisdom being

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' ni //
translated: is accomplished as a buddha or bodhisattva

original: bsgrubs te gzhan yang du ma yin //
analyzed: bsgrubs te gzhan yang du ma yin //
translated: and not as anything else.

original: dza h'um bam ho:bka' lung 'dis //
analyzed: dza h'um bam ho:bka' lung 'dis //
translated: With jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, this command,

original: goo r'i la sogs bzhi po 'dis //
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs bzhi po 'dis //
translated: these four—Gaurī, and so on—

original: dgug dang 'di ni gzhug pa dang // bcing dang rjes su dgyes par bya //🔽mig la sogs pa gti mug sogs //
analyzed: dgug dang 'di ni gzhug pa dang // bcing dang rjes su dgyes par bya // mig la sogs pa gti mug sogs //
translated: summon, cause to enter, bind, and control.

original: rdo rje gsum ni gnas gsum bsam //🔽mig gnyis rdo rje gti mug ma //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni gnas gsum bsam // mig gnyis rdo rje gti mug ma //
translated: Mmk, and so on, are the three vajras in the three places.🔽The two eyes are Vajra Delusion.

original: rna gnyis zhe sdang rdo rje ma //
analyzed: rna gnyis zhe sdang rdo rje ma //
translated: The two ears are Vajra Aversion.

original: sna ni ser sna ma zhes brjod //🔽kha la 'dod chags rdo rje ma //
analyzed: sna ni ser sna ma zhes brjod // kha la 'dod chags rdo rje ma //
translated: The nose is called “avarice.”🔽The mouth is the vajra of passion.

original: lus la phrag dog rdo rje ma //
analyzed: lus la phrag dog rdo rje ma //
translated: The body is the vajra of envy.

original: yid la bdag med rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: yid la bdag med rnal 'byor ma //
translated: The mind is the yoginī Nairātmya.

original: ming gi yi ge dang pos bskyed ;
analyzed: ming gi yi ge dang pos bskyed ;
translated: They are generated by the first letters of their names.

original: / phyag gnyis zhal gcig bzang po yi //
analyzed: / phyag gnyis zhal gcig bzang po yi //
translated: They have two arms, one face, and are beautiful.

original: gri gug thod pa lag na bcas //
analyzed: gri gug thod pa lag na bcas //
translated: They hold flaying knives and skulls in their hands.

original: sna tshogs mdog can ro yi gdan //
analyzed: sna tshogs mdog can ro yi gdan //
translated: They have various colors and sit on corpse seats.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi gnas su ni //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi gnas su ni //
translated: In the places of body, speech, and mind

original: aom a'a:h'u% ni 'di yi sngags //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'u% ni 'di yi sngags //
translated: are the mantras oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: 'di las mkha' spyod sa spyod ma //
analyzed: 'di las mkha' spyod sa spyod ma //
translated: From these, the sky-farers and earth-farers

original: zhabs 'og gnas pa'i bsam gtan bya //
analyzed: zhabs 'og gnas pa'i bsam gtan bya //
translated: are visualized below the feet.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
translated: The vajras of body, speech, and mind

original: rnal 'byor ma ni rigs gsum dngos //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni rigs gsum dngos //
translated: are the three families of yoginīs.

original: rang snying sa bon khyad par spro //
analyzed: rang snying sa bon khyad par spro //
translated: The seed in one’s heart is especially emanated.

original: lcags kyu'i gzugs kyi 'od zer gyis //
analyzed: lcags kyu'i gzugs kyi 'od zer gyis //
translated: With light rays in the form of hooks,

original: sangs rgyas spyan drangs yang dag mchod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas spyan drangs yang dag mchod //
translated: the buddhas are invited and perfectly worshipped.

original: dbang bskur ba ni blang ba'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni blang ba'o //
translated: The empowerment is conferred and accepted.

original: mgon po de bzhin gshegs thams cad //
analyzed: mgon po de bzhin gshegs thams cad //
translated: The protector is all tathāgatas.

original: khyed kyis bdag la dbang bskur cig / de nas de bzhin gshegs 'di dag / he ru ka gzugs byas nas ni //🔽bdud rtsi lnga yi chus gang ba'i //
analyzed: khyed kyis bdag la dbang bskur cig / de nas de bzhin gshegs 'di dag / he ru ka gzugs byas nas ni // bdud rtsi lnga yi chus gang ba'i //
translated: holding in their hands

original: bum pa nyid kyi phyag gis bsnams //
analyzed: bum pa nyid kyi phyag gis bsnams //
translated: the very vases filled with the water of the five nectars,🔽having poured it, confer the consecration.

original: blugs te dbang bskur mtha' ru 'di'i //
analyzed: blugs te dbang bskur mtha' ru 'di'i //
translated: In the end, this

original: rtsa ba'i mi bskyod phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i mi bskyod phyag rgya'o //
translated: is the root mudra of Akshobhya.🔽Then again, this is the mudra of Gauri

original: de ni yang ni goo r'i dang // pukka s'i 'di'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ni yang ni goo r'i dang // pukka s'i 'di'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: and PukkasI.

original: sangs rgyas rin chen dpag med yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rin chen dpag med yang //
translated: The immeasurable jewel Buddhas

original: phyi ma drug la gnyis gnyis rim //
analyzed: phyi ma drug la gnyis gnyis rim //
translated: are in the last six, two by two.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka ta badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /🔽'bud pa dang / 'bar ba dang / thod pa dang / lcags kyu lnga dang / sa bon lngar gyur pa'i bdud rtsi'i ro myong bar byed @129a * //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka ta badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham / 'bud pa dang / 'bar ba dang / thod pa dang / lcags kyu lnga dang / sa bon lngar gyur pa'i bdud rtsi'i ro myong bar byed @129a * //
translated: Om, all Tathagatas, I have been consecrated! I am a vajra being!

original: pa la ; / rdo rje nas kyi 'bru tsam bsams te /
analyzed: pa la ; / rdo rje nas kyi 'bru tsam bsams te /
translated: One should imagine a vajra the size of a mustard seed, and taste the nectar that has become the five elixirs, the five seed syllables, the five hooks, the five flames, the five inhalations, and the five skulls.

original: dpal kye rdo rje brtag pa'o //
analyzed: dpal kye rdo rje brtag pa'o //
translated: The chapter on the glorious Hevajra.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa mri ta sva da na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa mri ta sva da na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham //
translated: Oṃ, I am the essence of the pledge of the elixir of all the tathāgatas.

original: ye shes mchod pa sna tshogs sogs //
analyzed: ye shes mchod pa sna tshogs sogs //
translated: The various offerings of wisdom and so forth

original: lha mo 'di brgyad mchod pa ni //
analyzed: lha mo 'di brgyad mchod pa ni //
translated: are the offerings of these eight goddesses.

original: spro zhing 'khor lo'i bdag po ni //
analyzed: spro zhing 'khor lo'i bdag po ni //
translated: The one who is delighted and the lord of the wheel

original: 'khor lo'i bdag nyid pas sngon mchod //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i bdag nyid pas sngon mchod //
translated: is the one who was previously offered by the lord of the wheel.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ, I am the essence of the vajra offering of all the tathāgatas.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni de dag gis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni de dag gis //
translated: Those yoginīs

original: 'khor lo'i gtso bo la bstod pa //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i gtso bo la bstod pa //
translated: praise the chief of the wheel:

original: khyod ni rnal 'byor ma rnams bskor //
analyzed: khyod ni rnal 'byor ma rnams bskor //
translated: “You are surrounded by the yoginīs.

original: nyid kyi thugs kyis khyod dgongs grub //
analyzed: nyid kyi thugs kyis khyod dgongs grub //
translated: You are accomplished by your own mind.

original: rgyu dang mi rgyu 'khor ba kun sgrub pa ;
analyzed: rgyu dang mi rgyu 'khor ba kun sgrub pa ;
translated: You accomplish all the animate and inanimate worlds,

original: / snying rje'i thugs kyis sems can byang chub tu //
analyzed: / snying rje'i thugs kyis sems can byang chub tu //
translated: and you bring sentient beings to enlightenment with your compassionate mind.

original: kun rdzob sgyu mas byang chub sgrub pa'i yid //🔽dgyes pa'i shr'i he ru ka rdo rje bstod //
analyzed: kun rdzob sgyu mas byang chub sgrub pa'i yid // dgyes pa'i shr'i he ru ka rdo rje bstod //
translated: The mind that accomplishes enlightenment through the illusion of the relative🔽is the delighted Śrī Heruka Vajra.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta stu ti badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta stu ti badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham //
translated: Oṃ, I am the essence of the vajra praise of all the tathāgatas.

original: rdo rje rjes su chags byed dang // sangs rgyas gzhal med bye brag bsgom //
analyzed: rdo rje rjes su chags byed dang // sangs rgyas gzhal med bye brag bsgom //
translated: and the contemplation of the inconceivable buddha.🔽The empowerment, the tasting of elixir,🔽and the six branches of offering and praise.

original: dbang bskur bdud rtsi myang ba dang // mchod pa bstod pa yan lag drug / yan lag drug bsgom rnal 'byor gang //
analyzed: dbang bskur bdud rtsi myang ba dang // mchod pa bstod pa yan lag drug / yan lag drug bsgom rnal 'byor gang //
translated: The yogi who meditates on the six branches

original: de ni myur du dngos grub thob //
analyzed: de ni myur du dngos grub thob //
translated: will quickly attain siddhi.

original: pho brang sangs rgyas rnam snang mdzad //
analyzed: pho brang sangs rgyas rnam snang mdzad //
translated: The palace is Buddha Vairocana.

original: dbang ni mi bskyod de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: dbang ni mi bskyod de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The empowerment is the Tathagata Akshobhya.

original: bdud rtsi myang ba 'od dpag med //
analyzed: bdud rtsi myang ba 'od dpag med //
translated: The tasting of elixir is Amitabha.

original: bstod pa rin chen 'byung ldan dpal //
analyzed: bstod pa rin chen 'byung ldan dpal //
translated: The praise is the glorious Ratnasambhava.

original: mchod pa don yod yang dag mchod //
analyzed: mchod pa don yod yang dag mchod //
translated: The offering is the perfect Amoghasiddhi.

original: rjes chags rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rjes chags rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The passion is Vajrasattva.

original: dngos grub 'di ni nye ba yi //
analyzed: dngos grub 'di ni nye ba yi //
translated: This siddhi is close by.

original: yan lag drug gis bskyed pa ni //
analyzed: yan lag drug gis bskyed pa ni //
translated: The generation by the six branches

original: dang po sprin dang 'dra ba mthong //
analyzed: dang po sprin dang 'dra ba mthong //
translated: first sees a cloud-like appearance.

original: gnyis pa du ba 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: gnyis pa du ba 'dra ba ste //
translated: The second is like smoke,

original: gsum pa glog gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa glog gi rnam pa'o //
translated: the third is like a flash of lightning,🔽the fourth is like a blazing lamp,

original: bzhi pa mar me 'bar ba dang // lnga pa thams cad snang ba ste //
analyzed: bzhi pa mar me 'bar ba dang // lnga pa thams cad snang ba ste //
translated: the fifth is the appearance of everything,

original: sprin med nam mkha' 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: sprin med nam mkha' 'dra ba'o //
translated: like a cloudless sky.

original: phyis ni sgyu ma'i rnam pa mtshungs //
analyzed: phyis ni sgyu ma'i rnam pa mtshungs //
translated: Later, it is similar to an illusory form.

original: rmi lam snang ba skad cig go //
analyzed: rmi lam snang ba skad cig go //
translated: The appearance in a dream is momentary.

original: lte bar gtum mo 'bar ba yis //
analyzed: lte bar gtum mo 'bar ba yis //
translated: The fierce inner heat blazes at the navel.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga bsregs te //
translated: The five tathāgatas are burned.

original: spyan la sogs pa yang bsregs pa //
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa yang bsregs pa //
translated: Even Locanā and so on are burned.

original: bsregs pas ham las ri bong 'byung //
analyzed: bsregs pas ham las ri bong 'byung //
translated: Burned, the rabbit arises from haṃ.

original: bsam gtan mi nus rnal 'byor gang //
analyzed: bsam gtan mi nus rnal 'byor gang //
translated: The yogi who is unable to meditate

original: don ni dag pa rjes su dran //🔽snying rje spyan ni dmar po ste //
analyzed: don ni dag pa rjes su dran // snying rje spyan ni dmar po ste //
translated: remembers the pure meaning.🔽Compassion is the red eyes,

original: yan lag nag po byams pa'i thugs //
analyzed: yan lag nag po byams pa'i thugs //
translated: and the black limbs are the mind of love.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi pa ni //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi pa ni //
translated: The four means of gathering are

original: zhabs ni rnam pa bzhi zhes brjod //
analyzed: zhabs ni rnam pa bzhi zhes brjod //
translated: said to be the four feet.

original: zhal brgyad rnam par thar pa yin //
analyzed: zhal brgyad rnam par thar pa yin //
translated: The eight faces are the liberations.

original: bcu drug phyag @129b ni stong pa ste //
analyzed: bcu drug phyag @129b ni stong pa ste //
translated: The sixteen arms are the emptinesses.

original: phyag rgya lnga ni sangs rgyas yin //
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga ni sangs rgyas yin //
translated: The five mudras are the buddhas.

original: khro bo gdug pa 'dul ba po //
analyzed: khro bo gdug pa 'dul ba po //
translated: The wrathful one tames the unruly.

original: spyan gsum po ni sku gsum mo //
analyzed: spyan gsum po ni sku gsum mo //
translated: The three eyes are the three bodies.

original: rus pa bden pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rus pa bden pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The bones are the four truths.

original: gzugs ni rdo rje ma yin te //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdo rje ma yin te //
translated: Form is Vajrī,

original: tshor ba gsang ba'i goo r'i ma //
analyzed: tshor ba gsang ba'i goo r'i ma //
translated: and feeling is Guhyagaurī.

original: de bzhin chu ma 'du shes phung //
analyzed: de bzhin chu ma 'du shes phung //
translated: Likewise, perception is Apacāriṇī.

original: 'du byed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: 'du byed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: The vajra dakini of formation.

original: rnam shes 'di ni bdag med ma //
analyzed: rnam shes 'di ni bdag med ma //
translated: This consciousness is Nairatmya.

original: don dam la ni phung po med //
analyzed: don dam la ni phung po med //
translated: In the ultimate, there are no aggregates.

original: de ni yan lag drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni yan lag drug tu 'gyur //
translated: That is the six limbs.

original: skye mched drug ni dag pa yi //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni dag pa yi //
translated: The six sense bases are pure.

original: zhe sdang rdo rje rdo rje ma //
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje rdo rje ma //
translated: Dveṣavajrā is the vajra.

original: rdo rje ro ma 'bab ri yin //🔽phrag dog rdo rje ma de bzhin //
analyzed: rdo rje ro ma 'bab ri yin // phrag dog rdo rje ma de bzhin //
translated: The vajra rasanā is the mountain.🔽Likewise, īrṣyāvajrā.

original: gti mug rdo rje ma yang ni //🔽yin te rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: gti mug rdo rje ma yang ni // yin te rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: Mohavajrā is also🔽the vajra dakini.

original: ser sna gsang ba'i goo r'i ma //
analyzed: ser sna gsang ba'i goo r'i ma //
translated: Mātsaryagopā is the secret.

original: yid la bdag med rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: yid la bdag med rnal 'byor ma //
translated: The mind is Nairātmyāyoginī.

original: sa ni pukka s'i ru brjod //
analyzed: sa ni pukka s'i ru brjod //
translated: The earth is said to be Pukkasī.

original: chu rnams ri khrod ma zhes zer //
analyzed: chu rnams ri khrod ma zhes zer //
translated: The waters are said to be Caṇḍālī.

original: drod ni gtum mor shes par bya //
analyzed: drod ni gtum mor shes par bya //
translated: Heat is known as Ḍombinī.

original: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu brjod //🔽gzugs ni goo r'ir yang dag bshad //
analyzed: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu brjod // gzugs ni goo r'ir yang dag bshad //
translated: Wind is said to be Lāmā.🔽Form is said to be Gaurī.

original: sgra ni chom rkun ma ru bshad //
analyzed: sgra ni chom rkun ma ru bshad //
translated: Sound is said to be Caurī.

original: so so'i dri ni langs ma //🔽ro yi tshul ni za phod ma //
analyzed: so so'i dri ni langs ma // ro yi tshul ni za phod ma //
translated: Individual smell is Vetālī.🔽The way of taste is Ghasmarī.

original: reg bya sa spyod ma zhes brjod //
analyzed: reg bya sa spyod ma zhes brjod //
translated: Touch is said to be Pukkasi.

original: chos kyi khams ni mkha' spyod ma //
analyzed: chos kyi khams ni mkha' spyod ma //
translated: The element of phenomena is Ḍākinī.

original: sa ni dang por nor sbyin mtha' //
analyzed: sa ni dang por nor sbyin mtha' //
translated: The first [square] is for giving wealth, the last for [obtaining] land.

original: phyug po thams cad sa 'grub bo //
analyzed: phyug po thams cad sa 'grub bo //
translated: All [squares] are for the accomplishment of wealth.

original: glang po la sogs 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: glang po la sogs 'dzin pa ni //
translated: [The square] for holding an elephant, etc.

original: nad ni nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nad ni nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: is for the pacification of disease.

original: glo dang dbugs dang de bzhin smyo //
analyzed: glo dang dbugs dang de bzhin smyo //
translated: [The square] for the wind, and likewise for insanity,

original: khrag skyugs mdze nad birdzi ka / mcher pa mchin pa rang gzugs ni //
analyzed: khrag skyugs mdze nad birdzi ka / mcher pa mchin pa rang gzugs ni //
translated: for vomiting blood, for leprosy, for the spleen, and for the liver,

original: glang po la sogs rab tu brjod //
analyzed: glang po la sogs rab tu brjod //
translated: are said to be for the elephant, etc.

original: ni ram su 'am gzhan las ni //
analyzed: ni ram su 'am gzhan las ni //
translated: [The square] for Nirmāṇa, or for another,

original: bsam gtan sngags kyi bzlas pa bya //
analyzed: bsam gtan sngags kyi bzlas pa bya //
translated: is for the recitation of the meditation mantra.

original: aom aasht'a na n'a ya bim gordha ke sha wartma ne /
analyzed: aom aasht'a na n'a ya bim gordha ke sha wartma ne /
translated: Oṃ aṣṭānāṃ vināyakānām

original: tsa turbim sha ti /
analyzed: tsa turbim sha ti /
translated: catuḥṣaṣṭīnām

original: ne tr'a ya /
analyzed: ne tr'a ya /
translated: netrāṇām

original: sho da sha bhu dz'a ya /🔽krishna dz'i m'u ta wa pu she /
analyzed: sho da sha bhu dz'a ya / krishna dz'i m'u ta wa pu she /
translated: ṣoḍaśabhujāya🔽kṛṣṇa-jīmūta-vapuṣe

original: ka p'a la m'a l'a ne k'a dh'a ri ne /
analyzed: ka p'a la m'a l'a ne k'a dh'a ri ne /
translated: kapāla-mālā-nātha-dhāriṇe

original: a'atm'a ta kr'u ra tsitt'a ya aardhendu damshtri ne /
analyzed: a'atm'a ta kr'u ra tsitt'a ya aardhendu damshtri ne /
translated: ātma-kṛpā-citta-ardhendu-daṃṣṭriṇe

original: m'a ra ya m'a ra ya /
analyzed: m'a ra ya m'a ra ya /
translated: māraya māraya

original: k'a ra ya k'a ra ya /🔽gardzdza ya gardzdza ya /
analyzed: k'a ra ya k'a ra ya / gardzdza ya gardzdza ya /
translated: kāraya kāraya🔽garjaya garjaya

original: tardzdza ya tardzdza ya /
analyzed: tardzdza ya tardzdza ya /
translated: tarjaya tarjaya

original: sho sha ya sho sha ya /
analyzed: sho sha ya sho sha ya /
translated: śoṣaya śoṣaya

original: sapta s'a ga r'a na /
analyzed: sapta s'a ga r'a na /
translated: sapta-sāgara-nām

original: bandha bandha / n'a g'ashta k'an /
analyzed: bandha bandha / n'a g'ashta k'an /
translated: bandha bandha🔽nāgāṣṭakān

original: grihna grihna sarba sha tr'um /
analyzed: grihna grihna sarba sha tr'um /
translated: grihṇa grihṇa sarvaśatrūn

original: ha h'a hi h'i hu h'u he hee ho hoo ham ha:phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ha h'a hi h'i hu h'u he hee ho hoo ham ha:phat sv'a h'a /
translated: ha ha hī hū hūṃ he hai ho hau haṃ haḥ phaṭ svāhā

original: bar chad thams cad nyer zhi'i phyir //
analyzed: bar chad thams cad nyer zhi'i phyir //
translated: In order to completely pacify all obstacles,

original: gtor ma rgyun du sbyin par bya //
analyzed: gtor ma rgyun du sbyin par bya //
translated: one should always give bali offerings.

original: aom aindam dza ma dza la dzakkha bh'u ta bahni b'a au r'akkha tsanda sudzdza ma da bappa ta la p'a t'a le aashta sappa sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aindam dza ma dza la dzakkha bh'u ta bahni b'a au r'akkha tsanda sudzdza ma da bappa ta la p'a t'a le aashta sappa sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ indra jama jama jala jakṣa bhūta bāhni vā urāka chaṇḍa sujjāma dadabapatala pāṭālī aṣṭa sappa svāhā

original: ai dam ba lim bhum dza dzim gha phulla dh'uppa m'am sa pim ga aambha sappa kadzdza s'a da /
analyzed: ai dam ba lim bhum dza dzim gha phulla dh'uppa m'am sa pim ga aambha sappa kadzdza s'a da /
translated: Idam balim bhum ja jhim gha pulla dhūpa māṃsa pīma ambha sappaka kaja sād

original: khanti khu ni /
analyzed: khanti khu ni /
translated: kānti khuni

original: phe ta g'a da /
analyzed: phe ta g'a da /
translated: peta gād

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharmm'a n'am /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharmm'a n'am /
translated: Oṃ akāro mukhaṃ sarvadharmāṇām,

original: a'adya nutpanna tv'ata aom a'a:h'u% phat sv'a h'a //
analyzed: a'adya nutpanna tv'ata aom a'a:h'u% phat sv'a h'a //
translated: ādyanutpannatvāta oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: lha mo'i rgyud kyi padma mang po ni //
analyzed: lha mo'i rgyud kyi padma mang po ni //
translated: The many lotuses of the goddess tantra

original: @130a * // bla ma zhi bas nyi ma'i 'od kyis phye //
analyzed: @130a * // bla ma zhi bas nyi ma'i 'od kyis phye //
translated: are opened by the light of the guru's sun.

original: mi thub zla bas sbrang rtsi gzhibs 'thungs bas //
analyzed: mi thub zla bas sbrang rtsi gzhibs 'thungs bas //
translated: Indomitable Moon drinks the honey of their nectar.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs ni sbrang rtsi skyugs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs ni sbrang rtsi skyugs pa'o //
translated: The means of accomplishment is the vomiting of honey.

original: dpal gyi thugs rje'i stobs kyis sgrub thabs byas //
analyzed: dpal gyi thugs rje'i stobs kyis sgrub thabs byas //
translated: The means of accomplishment is made by the power of Śrī's compassion.

original: 'di las ngal bar gyur pa'i bsod nams gang //
analyzed: 'di las ngal bar gyur pa'i bsod nams gang //
translated: Whatever merit there is from this,

original: des thob skye ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'i //🔽theg pa 'gro ba sgrol ba'i rgyur gyur cig / yan lag drug pa'i sgrub thabs zhes bya ba //
analyzed: des thob skye ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'i // theg pa 'gro ba sgrol ba'i rgyur gyur cig / yan lag drug pa'i sgrub thabs zhes bya ba //
translated: may it become the cause for crossing the ocean of births🔽and for the vehicle that liberates beings.🔽The Means of Accomplishment of the Six Branches, called The Moon That Cannot Be Overcome,

original: slob dpon mi thub zla bas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon mi thub zla bas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: is complete.

original: // / bla ma dam pas bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: // / bla ma dam pas bka' stsal pa //
translated: The holy guru has said:

original: dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis //
analyzed: dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis //
translated: The monk Śākya Ye-she

original: yan lag drug pa'i sgrub thabs 'di //
analyzed: yan lag drug pa'i sgrub thabs 'di //
translated: has made this means of accomplishment of the six branches

original: sh'akya dkon mchog bdag med la //
analyzed: sh'akya dkon mchog bdag med la //
translated: for the sake of Śākya Könchok Nyingpo

original: rnal 'byor ma ni thams cad phyir //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni thams cad phyir //
translated: and for all yoginīs.

original: nus pas bsgyur ba gang yod pa //
analyzed: nus pas bsgyur ba gang yod pa //
translated: Whatever has been changed by ability,🔽may it quickly attain Hevajra.

original: kye yi rdo rje myur thob shog / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ratna shr'i dzny'a na ri zhal snga nas dang / dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: kye yi rdo rje myur thob shog / rgya gar gyi mkhan po ratna shr'i dzny'a na ri zhal snga nas dang / dge slong sh'akya ye shes kyis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: It was translated by the Indian preceptor Ratnākaraśānti and the monk Śākya Ye-she.
